intro: Seriphidium kaschgaricum, commonly known as the Karakoram wormwood, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its medicinal properties. Seriphidium kaschgaricum is valued for its essential oils and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
